p: Although zingiberene was the major compound in essential oils coming from both fresh and dried ginger rhizomes from Trivandrum (India), fresh ginger essential oil contained more oxygenated sesquiterpenes compared to the dried one which contained large amounts of the sesquiterpene hydrocarbons ar-curcumene (11.0%), β-bisabolene (7.2%), sesquiphellandrene (6.6%), and δ-cadinene (3.5%) [ 34].
